requirement_tested: Create new to-do items with title and description fields
user_persona: A busy professional named Alex who manages daily tasks.
user_goal: Alex wants to quickly add a new task with a title and description to the to-do list.

narrative_steps.title: Opening the App
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the app and sees the lavender background with an indigo-styled form at the top ready for input.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the page load.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a lavender background and an indigo-themed task creation form visible at the top.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Task Details
narrative_steps.description: Alex fills in the title and description fields with 'Finish report' and 'Complete quarterly sales report by Friday'.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Finish report' into the title input and 'Complete quarterly sales report by Friday' into the description textarea.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both fields accept text input and display the typed content accurately.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Task
narrative_steps.description: After filling in the details, Alex clicks the 'Add Task' button to save the new task.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add Task' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is added to the database, appears in the task list, and the form fields are cleared.

requirement_tested: Edit existing to-do items including title and description
user_persona: A project manager named Taylor reviewing team assignments.
user_goal: Taylor needs to update the title and description of an existing task.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Task
narrative_steps.description: Taylor finds the task titled 'Prepare presentation slides' in the list and hovers over it.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over the task item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An edit icon appears on the task card.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Edit Mode
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the edit icon to modify the task details.
narrative_steps.action: Click the edit icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task transforms into an editable form with pre-filled title and description fields.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Task Information
narrative_steps.description: Taylor updates the title to 'Prepare Q3 presentation slides' and adds 'Include budget analysis' to the description.
narrative_steps.action: Modify the title and description fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The fields reflect the updated text as entered.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Changes
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the changes, Taylor clicks the save button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the save button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is updated in the database and returns to read-only mode with the new information displayed.

user_persona: A student named Jordan cleaning up old assignments.
user_goal: Jordan wants to remove a completed assignment task that is no longer needed.

narrative_steps.title: Identifying Unnecessary Task
narrative_steps.description: Jordan scrolls through the list and identifies the outdated task 'Read Chapter 5'.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the task in the list view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is visible within the list with its associated action icons.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Task
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clicks the trash can icon next to the task to delete it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the trash can icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is removed from the database and disappears from the list view instantly without a page refresh.

requirement_tested: Mark to-do items as completed with visual indication
user_persona: A freelancer named Riley tracking daily goals.
user_goal: Riley wants to mark a task as completed after finishing work on it.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Active Task
narrative_steps.description: Riley locates the task 'Design client logo' in the active task list.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to find the target task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task appears normally with dark text and no strikethrough.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Task
narrative_steps.description: Riley clicks the checkbox next to the task title to mark it as done.
narrative_steps.action: Click the checkbox.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task's title becomes strikethrough with faded text, and a checkmark icon appears, indicating completion.

requirement_tested: Filter to-do items by status (all, active, completed)
user_persona: A remote worker named Casey organizing weekly priorities.
user_goal: Casey wants to view only the tasks that still need attention.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing All Tasks
narrative_steps.description: Casey starts by viewing all tasks mixed together.
narrative_steps.action: Load the default task list view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All tasks are displayed regardless of their completion status.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Active Tasks
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks the 'Active' filter button to focus only on pending work.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Active' filter button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only tasks marked as not completed are shown in the list.

requirement_tested: Search to-do items by keyword across titles and descriptions
user_persona: A researcher named Morgan looking for specific project notes.
user_goal: Morgan wants to find tasks related to 'market research' quickly.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Morgan notices the search bar positioned above the task list and focuses on it.
narrative_steps.action: Focus on the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The search bar is clearly visible with a magnifying glass icon.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Search
narrative_steps.description: Morgan types 'market research' and presses Enter to initiate the search.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'market research' and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task list updates dynamically to show only tasks whose titles or descriptions contain 'market research'.

requirement_tested: Browse all to-do items in a list view
user_persona: A team lead named Quinn reviewing overall progress.
user_goal: Quinn wants to get an overview of all current tasks assigned to the team.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Task List
narrative_steps.description: Quinn navigates to the main dashboard to see all tasks.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the main task list page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All tasks are displayed in a vertically stacked list format on a lavender background.

narrative_steps.title: Scanning Through Tasks
narrative_steps.description: Quinn scans the list to assess workload distribution among team members.
narrative_steps.action: Visually scan the list of tasks.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each task is presented in an indigo-bordered card showing relevant information like title, description snippet, and creation date.

requirement_tested: Display to-do items with clear visual distinction between completed and active tasks
user_persona: A designer named Avery checking project milestones.
user_goal: Avery wants to distinguish between finished and pending design tasks at a glance.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Task Styles
narrative_steps.description: Avery looks at the task list and notices different styling for various tasks.
narrative_steps.action: Examine the visual presentation of tasks.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Active tasks appear with normal dark text while completed tasks show strikethrough and lighter gray text.

requirement_tested: Provide a text input field for entering new task titles
user_persona: A writer named Sam planning article topics.
user_goal: Sam wants to enter several new article idea titles efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Title Field
narrative_steps.description: Sam focuses on the topmost input field labeled for task titles.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the title input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The cursor appears in a single-line text input styled with indigo border and lavender background.

narrative_steps.title: Typing Task Title
narrative_steps.description: Sam enters 'Top 10 productivity tips' into the title field.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Top 10 productivity tips' into the input.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The text is clearly visible and properly formatted within the styled input field.

requirement_tested: Include a text area for detailed task descriptions
user_persona: A developer named Lee documenting code features.
user_goal: Lee wants to write detailed implementation notes for a coding task.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Description Area
narrative_steps.description: After entering the title, Lee moves to the larger text area below for detailed notes.
narrative_steps.action: Focus on the description text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A multi-line text area with matching indigo border and lavender background styling is available.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Detailed Notes
narrative_steps.description: Lee writes implementation steps and edge cases into the description area.
narrative_steps.action: Type detailed notes into the text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple lines of text are accepted and scrollable if needed within the styled container.

requirement_tested: Show a counter displaying total and completed task numbers
user_persona: A product owner named Dana tracking sprint progress.
user_goal: Dana wants to monitor how many tasks remain uncompleted in the current sprint.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Initial Count
narrative_steps.description: Dana glances at the status bar to see the starting number of tasks.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the task counter display.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The counter shows the total number of tasks and how many are completed.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Progress
narrative_steps.description: As tasks are completed, Dana checks that the counter updates accordingly.
narrative_steps.action: Complete a few tasks and observe the counter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The counter dynamically updates to reflect the reduced number of remaining tasks.

requirement_tested: Enable task sorting by creation date or priority
user_persona: A manager named Pat prioritizing urgent deliverables.
user_goal: Pat wants to sort tasks by priority to address critical items first.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Sort Options
narrative_steps.description: Pat finds the 'Sort By:' dropdown menu near the top of the task list.
narrative_steps.action: Click the sort dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown menu with 'Creation Date' and 'Priority' options appears.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Priority Sorting
narrative_steps.description: Pat selects 'Priority' to reorder the tasks accordingly.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Priority' from the dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task list reorders itself to show high-priority tasks first, maintaining any active filters.

requirement_tested: Implement responsive design for mobile and desktop viewing
user_persona: A consultant named Robin managing tasks on multiple devices.
user_goal: Robin wants to seamlessly switch between desktop and mobile views without losing functionality.

narrative_steps.title: Desktop View Experience
narrative_steps.description: On a large monitor, Robin enjoys a wide layout with multiple columns of tasks.
narrative_steps.action: View the app on a desktop screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tasks are arranged in a multi-column layout optimized for wide screens.

narrative_steps.title: Mobile Adaptation
narrative_steps.description: Switching to a phone, Robin sees the same features but in a single-column stack.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate mobile view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts to a single column with preserved lavender background and indigo-styled components.

requirement_tested: Apply lavender background color consistently across all pages
user_persona: A UX reviewer named Kai evaluating visual consistency.
user_goal: Kai wants to confirm that every page maintains the specified lavender background theme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Kai navigates through different sections of the application to verify background uniformity.
narrative_steps.action: Visit various pages and inspect backgrounds.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Every page displays a consistent solid lavender (#E6E6FA) background throughout the application.

requirement_tested: Style all UI components with indigo color scheme
user_persona: A brand specialist named Zoe ensuring design alignment.
user_goal: Zoe wants to ensure all interactive elements use the correct indigo color palette.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Zoe examines buttons, checkboxes, and input fields for proper indigo styling.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect various UI components visually.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive elements including buttons, checkboxes, and form controls utilize indigo (#6366F1) as their primary accent color.
